overview: The purpose of this Act is to amend and establish various definitions and penalties for fireworks offenses, including establishing heightened penalties under certain circumstances. [8] This measure also establishes various criminal offenses and penalties related to fireworks or articles pyrotechnic and adds fireworks infractions to the existing adjudication of infractions process for traffic and emergency period infractions. [8] The Act also appropriates funds for these purposes. [8]
appropriations: There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $ or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2026-2027 to carry out the purposes of this Act. [8] The sums appropriated shall be expended by the judiciary for the purposes of this Act. [8]

agency_impact: Creating a fireworks infractions system will allow law enforcement agencies and the judiciary to quickly and efficiently process low-level cases, while also allowing them to prioritize higher-level cases as appropriate. [8] Your Committees received testimony in support of this measure from the Office of the Attorney General, Department of Law Enforcement, Hawaii State Fire Council, Honolulu Police Department, Honolulu Fire Department, Hawai ªi Police Department, and the Department of the Prosecuting Attorney of the County of Maui. [9] [9] Testimony in opposition was received from the Office of the Public Defender and the Libertarian Party of Hawaii. [9] [9]
economic_impact: The legislature finds that the widespread use of illegal fireworks poses an extreme danger, and the cost to the community far outweighs any intrinsic benefit. [8] With the increase in fireworks-related calls, public safety agencies are heavily strained to maintain adequate response levels for other critical emergencies, which adds to the cost of state and county resources. [8] The system of processing traffic infractions established by this chapter will save the taxpayers money and reduce their frustration with the judicial system by simplifying the traffic court process. [8]
policy_impact: This measure will address critical weaknesses in the current regulatory framework by establishing a dedicated adjudication system that will streamline the processing of fireworks infractions, allowing for more efficient enforcement and prosecution. [9] The measure also establishes a graduated penalty structure that appropriately reflects the severity of violations, particularly those resulting in serious injury or death. [9] [9] The bill incorporates the fireworks violations adjudication process into the existing traffic and emergency procedure violations adjudication process within the Hawaii Revised Statutes. [9]
revenue_sources: The measure appropriates an unspecified sum from the general revenues of the State of Hawaii. [8] The bill requires payment of a fee of $25 (HB1483_SD1_.HTM.txt) for a permit for consumer fireworks and a fee of $110 (HB1483_SD1_.HTM.txt) for aerial devices or display fireworks. [8] [8] Additionally, the court shall impose an administrative fee of $20 (HB1483_SD1_.HTM.txt) for each fireworks infraction in which judgment is entered in favor of the State, with fees collected to be deposited into the judiciary computer system special fund.
